ClinicalDocument.title: NHS Continuing Healthcare Request for Assessment

td.content: Was the individual involved in the completion of the Checklist?
Was the individual offered the opportunity to have a representative such as a family member or other advocate present when the Checklist was completed?
If yes, did the representative attend the completion of the Checklist?
Does the patient have the mental capacity to consent or dissent to the undertaking of the assessment?
If No, Has a Best Interests Decision has been made on behalf of the patient
If No, Has a Third Party with Lasting Power of Attorney (Welfare), given consent on behalf of the patient
If No, Has a Third Party appointed Welfare Deputy by the Court of Protection, given consent on behalf of the patient
The Independent Mental Capacity Advocate has been consulted

th.content: The contact details of the individual providing consent on behalf of the patient

td.content: Evidence in records to support this level

tr.td: The individual has shown no evidence of challenging behaviour.

No evidence of impairment, confusion or disorientation.
OR
Cognitive impairment (for example, difficulties in retrieving short-term memory) which requires some supervision, prompting or assistance with more complex activities of daily living, such as finance and medication, but awareness of basic risks that affect their safety is evident.
OR
Occasional difficulty with memory and decisions/choices requiring support, prompting or assistance. However, the individual has insight into their impairment.
The individual has shown no evidence of challenging behaviour.

Mood disturbance or anxiety symptoms or periods of distress which do not readily respond to prompts and reassurance and have an increasing impact on the individual's health and/or well-being.
OR
Withdrawn from most attempts to engage them in support, care planning and/or daily activities.

The individual has shown evidence of mood disturbance or anxiety symptoms or periods of distress which do not readily respond to prompts and reassurance and have an increasing impact on the individual's health and/or well-being.

Needs assistance to communicate their needs. Special effort may be needed to ensure accurate interpretation of needs or additional support may be needed either visually, through touch or with hearing.
The individual has shown evidence of needing assistance to communicate, and require additional support with hearing issues.
The individual has shown evidence of being Independently mobile, for example they can ride a bicycle and drive a car.
Significant weight loss or gain due to an identified eating disorder.
The individual has shown evidence of significant weight loss, after following a reduced calorie controlled diet, combined with a regular exercise routine.
Continence care is problematic and requires timely and skilled intervention, beyond routine care.
The individual has shown evidence of requiring timely and skilled continence care, and has started Pelvic floor muscle training to to treat bowel incontinence.

Risk of skin breakdown which requires preventative intervention several times each day, without which skin integrity would break down.
OR
Pressure damage or open wound(s), pressure ulcer(s) with â€˜partial thickness skin loss involving epidermis and/or dermis', which is responding to treatment.
OR
A skin condition that requires a minimum of daily treatment, or daily monitoring/reassessment to ensure that it is responding to treatment.
The individual has atopic eczema and has shown evidence of requiring preventative intervention several times each day, without which skin integrity would break down.
Episodes of breathlessness that readily respond to management and have no impact on daily living activities.

The individual has episodes of breathlessness caused by Asthma. This condition is managed by regularly taking a corticosteroid inhaler in combination with a short-acting beta2-agonist inhaler, and so this condition has had no impact on daily living activities of the individual.

td.content: Drug therapies and medication/ symptom control*

tr.td: Symptoms are managed effectively and without any problems, and medication is not resulting in any unmanageable side-effects.
The individual has managed the symptoms effectively and without any problems, and medication is not resulting in any unmanageable side-effects.
Occasional episodes of ASC that require the supervision of a carer or care worker to minimise the risk of harm.
The individual has suffered occasional episodes of ASC that require the supervision of a carer or care worker to minimise the risk of harm.

td.content: Drug therapies and medication/ symptom control*

paragraph.content: *Note: Full assessment for NHS continuing healthcare is required if there are:

item.paragraph: two or more domains selected in column A;
five or more domains are selected in column B, or one selected in column A and four in B; or

one domain selected in column A in one of the boxes marked with an asterisk (i.e. those domains that carry a priority level in Decision Support Tool), with any number of selections in the other two columns.

tr.td: 1: Requires referral for Full Assessment for NHS Continuing Healthcare
Mrs Taylor is assessed in Nutrition and Continence. Since 2 domains are selected in column A, she is eligible for NHS Continuing Healthcare.
